caption: OurSPF200Heritage thursday Reserve Unit officers used water jets to disperse crowds in the Hock Lee bus riots that took place in 1955. The riots claimed the lives of two police officers, a news correspondent, and a 16-year old student who was paraded by the rioters for hours after sustaining a gunshot wound. Lets treasure what we have in Singapore today. : Ministry of Information and the Arts Collection, courtesy of (Colourised result of picture is generated by Colourise.sg.)

caption: Inter-generational Bonds in the Force:SI Mohamad Kamal is currently serving in the SPF band and has been with the SPF for the past 41 years. He serves as an inspiration for his son, ASP Mohamad Fazlin, who is currently a Ground Response Force Team Leader in Geylang Neighbourhood Police Centre (NPC). ASP Fazlin is happily married to SGT Nur Quraisyah, a Crime Strike Force officer from Marine Parade NPC.safeguardingeveryday singaporepoliceforce

More on how it happened, and what lies beyond 2020 in the link on our bio and IGstory! singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday thursday

The exhibition is open now till 17 May this year.singaporepoliceforcesafeguardingeverydaySPF200

caption: Today marks the opening of the SPF200 Exhibition - Frontier Town to Safest City which was officiated by Mr K Shanmugam, Minister for Home Affairs and Minister for Law. The exhibition is part of a year-long series of events to commemorate SPF200 with 2020 being the 200th year of policing in Singapore. The exhibition brings visitors through the Polices 200-year policing journey using stories of how its officers exhibited bravery in the face of danger, of bringing criminals to justice, and of duty above self. The exhibition also showcases a collection of archival photos, videos and artefacts, some of which date all the way back to 1821.The exhibition at the will run from 6 February to 17 May 2020. Come visit the exhibition today! Free admission for all. Sign up for guided tours by our ex-Police officers who will share their exciting stories with SPF while you walk down the memory lane with them!singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday spf200
cleaned_caption: Today marks the opening of the SPF200 Exhibition - Frontier Town to Safest City which was officiated by the Minister for Home Affairs and Minister for Law. The exhibition is part of a year-long series of events to commemorate SPF200 with 2020 being the 200th year of policing in Singapore. The exhibition brings visitors through the Police's 200-year policing journey using stories of how its officers exhibited bravery in the face of danger, of bringing criminals to justice, and of duty above self. The exhibition also showcases a collection of archival photos, videos and artefacts, some of which date all the way back to 1821. The exhibition will run from 6 February to 17 May 2020. Come visit the exhibition today! Free admission for all. Sign up for guided tours by ex-Police officers who will share their exciting stories with SPF while you walk down the memory lane with them! #singaporepoliceforce #safeguardingeveryday #spf200

caption: Introducing the team of SPF officers that conceptualised the Anti-Scam Centre (aka ASC). The ASC focuses on disrupting scammers operations to mitigate victims monetary losses. Particularly, it works closely with the three major local banks DBS Bank, OCBC Bank and UOB, to swiftly freeze suspicious bank accounts which are detected to be involved in scammers operations, and impede fund transfers involving such accounts. Are you with us in this fight against scammers? singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday

caption: Meet our very first female recipient of the Singapore Police Force Scholarship awarded by the Public Service Commission, Inspector Shermaine Ang! She shared that as she was growing up, she noticed how the community benefitted from swift and timely interventions by police officers. It made her see how the SPF is a community-facing organisation whose work makes a real impact on the everyday lives of Singaporeans. It is a privilege and joy to work together with like-minded Singaporeans who believe in giving their best to protect and secure our home. she said. singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday

caption: This week, we take a look at our Police Contingents involved in the parade and ceremony segment. Superintendent of Police (SUPT) Wilbur Sim and Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) Teo Khim Ying are proud and honoured to be representing SPF as the Contingent Commanders in this years National Day Parade (NDP)! SUPT Wilbur Sim, Head Operations and Security of Police Coast Guard, leads the SPF Guard of Honour Contingent. ASP Teo Khim Ying, Team Leader of Emergency Response Team at Bedok Police Division, will be leading the supporting Police Contingent as the Contingent Commander. Look out for these officers at the upcoming preview and NDP at Padang. Cheer them on by waving at them!

Visit the link in our bio and Insta-story to find out which other PNSFs received this prestigious award too!

caption: Seen them around in your daily commute? Yes, they are our officers from the Police Transport Command (TransCom)! The basic unit of TransComs frontline patrol resources is the Foot Patrol Group. One of their main tasks is to conduct high visibility foot patrols within the MRT system (i.e. MRT stations and trains) to detect and deter crime, including terrorism. They are often the first to respond to incidents reported in the public transport system.safeguardingeveryday singaporepoliceforce

caption: Do you know that the Volunteer Special Constabulary (VSC) officers are joining the combined volunteers contingent for the very first time at the NDP? Also, the Traffic Police bikes and expressway patrol cars in the mobile column are manned predominantly by VSC officers.Let's meet two of SPFs VSC officers taking part in this years parade! We have SSI(V) Hapit Osman, a VSC officer attached to the Traffic Police. He will be part of the mobile column drive-past at the parade. We also have ASP(V) Paul Seah Ching San, Deputy Head of the Recruitment Unit at VSC HQ, who is the reserve Contingent Commander for SAF - Home Team Volunteer Contingent. Dont forget to wave to these officers when you see them at the upcoming previews and NDP at Padang!

caption: Find this familiar? Yes, it is a snapshot of the Cairnhill Neighbourhood Police Post which first opened its doors in 1989! Introduced in 1983, the Neighbourhood Police Post (NPP) system was inspired by the Japanese Koban-style of policing and it helped to reduce crime rates in the neighbourhood. In 1997, the first Neighbourhood Police Centres (NPCs) were introduced. Fine-tuned from the NPP system, NPCs were bigger in size and scope of duties. Lets continue to work together to keep our neighbourhoods safe and crime-free. singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday

In 1997, the first Neighbourhood Police Centres (NPCs) were introduced. Fine-tuned from the NPP system, NPCs were bigger in size and scope of duties. Lets continue to work together to keep our neighbourhoods safe and crime-free.

caption: The Police works closely with community partners in Singapore to enhance their emergency preparedness and security measures against security threats. This is especially important in a hospital setting, where hospital staff play key roles to ensure the safety and security of their patients, who may be unable to run or hide on their own due to existing medical conditions. A counter-terrorism exercise codenamed Heartbeat was held at The Ang Mo Kio-Thye Hua Kwan Hospital today. The exercise was jointly organised by the Police and Thye Hua Kwan Moral Society, supported by the SCDF. This is the first time Exercise Heartbeat was held in a community hospital in Singapore, which reflects how community partners had taken ownership of their safety and security. More deets about what happened in bio and Insta-story! singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday

caption: The father-son duo, Station Inspector (SI) Mohamad Kamal and Assistant Superintendent (ASP) Mohamad Fazlin, have served the Singapore Police Force (SPF) for the last five years together. SI Kamal is a veteran officer who has gone on five United Nations (UN) missions as part of the United Nations Peacekeeping Force (UNPKF) between 1993 and 2008, and is now a Chief Musician in the SPF Band. ASP Fazlin currently leads a team of Ground Response Force officers in Geylang NPC. ASP Fazlin reminisced fondly about his childhood and how his father has influenced him. Read what the father and son have to say to each other on this Fathers Day on SPF FB (Link on bio). We wish all fathers a Happy Fathers Day! safeguardingeveryday fathersday2019

caption: Mr Peter Lim was elated when SC/CPL Ian Abdullah (left) and SGT Kalvin Ng (right) managed to save his dog despite the thick smoke from the fire in the next unit.Mr Peter Lim rushed to the first floor and started to warn people to keep away from the burning shophouse beside his unit when he first realised it was on fire. caption: On 25 March 2019 at about 7.40pm, in a joint operation with the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority, PCG detected an unnumbered fiberglass boat at the sea off Punggol Barat, Singapore. The boat then entered Singapore territorial waters and sped towards the shore of Punggol Barat. The boatman refused to stop his boat despite repeated verbal and visual warnings through firing of flares by the PCG. PCG then swiftly intercepted the boat and arrested the 46-year-old boatman. A 20-year-old man was subsequently arrested at the fencing along the coastline of Punggol Barat.The motorized fiberglass boat and cash amounting to RM$3,734 were seized.Preliminary investigations revealed that the Malaysian boatman had picked up the Bangladeshi man from the shoreline of Johor Bahru, Malaysia. Both men were arrested for entering Singapore unlawfully under the Immigration Act, Chapter 133.The boatman is also being investigated for engaging in the business or trade of conveying illegal immigrant to Singapore under Section 57(1)(c) of the Immigration Act, Chapter 133. safeguardingeveryday singaporepoliceforce
cleaned_caption: On 25 March 2019 at about 7.40pm, in a joint operation with the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority, PCG detected an unnumbered fiberglass boat at the sea off Punggol Barat, Singapore. The boat then entered Singapore territorial waters and sped towards the shore of Punggol Barat. The boatman refused to stop his boat despite repeated verbal and visual warnings through firing of flares by the PCG. PCG then swiftly intercepted the boat and arrested the boatman. A second man was subsequently arrested at the fencing along the coastline of Punggol Barat. The motorized fiberglass boat and cash amounting to RM$3,734 were seized. Preliminary investigations revealed that the boatman had picked up the other man from the shoreline of Johor Bahru, Malaysia. Both individuals were arrested for entering Singapore unlawfully under the Immigration Act, Chapter 133. The boatman is also being investigated for engaging in the business or trade of conveying illegal immigrants to Singapore under Section 57(1)(c) of the Immigration Act, Chapter 133. safeguardingeveryday singaporepoliceforce

caption: The road traffic situation in 2018 remained stable. There were fewer road traffic accidents overall, but the number of fatal accidents increased slightly. While there were fewer speeding violations and related accidents, there was an increase in the number of red-light running violations and related accidents, as well as drink-driving related accidents. Elderly pedestrians and motorcyclists continue to be of concern.singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday taketheroadtoresponsibility

caption: Woof woof! I am Gerry, a seven-year-old German Shepherd, trained as a Police Patrol Dog. Like the rain drops that have fallen on my fur, I feel my eyes watering as I think about my retirement in five months time. But no, I held it back as I am now on a mission with my dog handler, Station Inspector (SI) Yap Hong Lee. We are patrolling hand and paw together to protect the 33rd ASEAN Summit against public security and public order threats. SI Yap has been my handler since I joined the Force. Theres an indescribable bond between us as we have weathered uncountable days of rain and shine together. This may be my last major security deployment, but once a police dog, always a police dog! I will always remember my patrol moments with SI Yap. He is the best handler that a dog could have. For now, it is back to my duty to support my handler in his mission to safeguard the summit! Woof! Gerry

caption: Ms ChianhJia Xuan hasalways wanted to play a part in keeping Singapore safe as she strongly believes that the security climate of our nation determines the happiness of our people. Thus, serving with the force will allow her to contribute actively in maintaining the peace of the country and ensuring the safety of Singaporeans. Ms Chianhbegan volunteering with the Voluntary Special Constabulary since July last year and observed the rigour and tenacity required for the job.It is through this volunteering stint that Ms Chianh realized serving with the SPF is the career path for her as she looked forward to waking up to a challenging yet meaningful task every day. By majoring in psychology, she hopes to be able to contribute toa resilient culture in the force by preparing police officers for future challenges and sustaining their passion for the force.Congratulations to Ms Chianh for being one of the Local Merit Scholarship recipients at the Singapore Police Force Scholarship and Home Team Scholarship Award Ceremony 2018! Good job! singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday
cleaned_caption: Ms Chianh has always wanted to play a part in keeping Singapore safe as she strongly believes that the security climate of our nation determines the happiness of our people. Thus, serving with the force will allow her to contribute actively in maintaining the peace of the country and ensuring the safety of Singaporeans. Ms Chianh began volunteering with the Voluntary Special Constabulary since July last year and observed the rigour and tenacity required for the job. It is through this volunteering stint that she realized serving with the SPF is the career path for her as she looked forward to waking up to a challenging yet meaningful task every day. By majoring in psychology, she hopes to be able to contribute to a resilient culture in the force by preparing police officers for future challenges and sustaining their passion for the force. Congratulations to Ms Chianh for being one of the Local Merit Scholarship recipients at the Singapore Police Force Scholarship and Home Team Scholarship Award Ceremony 2018! Good job! #singaporepoliceforce #safeguardingeveryday

caption: Police NSF Hazim had no thoughts at all of joining the Singapore Police Force prior to his National Service (NS) stint. However, that changed after he met Senior Staff Sergeant (SSSgt) Aziz, his Course Manager at Training Command, and began his NS experience with the In-Situ Reaction Team of Protective Security Command (ProCom).His stint has exposed him to the wider roles that the Singapore Police Force plays in keeping the nation safe, especially so in ProCom where the responsibility stretches to counter-terrorism work and keeping key installations secure. The distinct spirit present in his team in a time where the security climate is uncertain further solidifies his decision to serve with the force. Hazim hopes that he can be posted back to ProCom one day so that he would be able to share and inspire other PNSFs on the work of the Singapore Police Force, just like his mentor SSSGT Aziz did. singaporepoliceforce safeguardingeveryday

caption: Station Inspector Syed Abu Bakar, a trained emergency medical technician, was involved in the rescue of passengers from a ferry which ran aground near Pulau Tekong on Monday night. The first thing that ran through his mind was to find out the extent of the victims injuries, so that he can prioritise the emergency care needed, and plan evacuation. The terrain added on to the difficulty of the rescue. We are glad that they are now safe! Find out more about this rescue operation from the link in our profile and insta-story. singaporepoliceforce policecoastguard safeguardingeveryday
cleaned_caption: Station Inspector, a trained emergency medical technician, was involved in the rescue of passengers from a ferry which ran aground near Pulau Tekong on Monday night. The terrain added on to the difficulty of the rescue. We are glad that they are now safe! Find out more about this rescue operation from the link in our profile and insta-story. #singaporepoliceforce #policecoastguard #safeguardingeveryday

caption: Senior Assistant Commissioner of Police (SAC) Florence Chua Siew Lian will take on the appointment of Director of Criminal Investigation Department (CID) with effect from 1 June 2018. She will be the first female Director of CID and Deputy Commissioner of Police.singaporepoliceforce

caption: Moms are our super heroes, So are our women police officers! Inspector Irene Yong inspires her son Anders to be righteous and courageous [1]. Staff Sergeant Rehka is a role model to her daughter Akshana, by showing her how to form close bonds with neighbours [2]. Staff Sergeant Siti teaches her son Aryan safe road habits, by practising the kerb drill with him - look right, look left, look right again, ensure all vehicles have stopped, raise your hand high up and cross the road briskly" [3]. We wish all mothers a Happy Mothers Day! Is your mom a superhero too? momisoursuperhero happymothersday

Staff Sergeant teaches her son safe road habits, by practising the kerb drill with him - look right, look left, look right again, ensure all vehicles have stopped, raise your hand high up and cross the road briskly. We wish all mothers a Happy Mothers Day! Is your mom a superhero too? momisoursuperhero happymothersday

caption: Congratulations to all our Honorary Aides-de-Camp (HADC) who were appointed by President Halimah Yacob at the HADC Appointment Ceremony and Appreciation Dinner last night! As HADCs, they help to plan, manage and execute state functions and events attended by the President. They may be identified by the thick distinctive cord worn across their right shoulder, called aiguillettes.Did you know that only ADCs from the Singapore Police Force wear silver aiguillettes while the other ADCs wear gold aiguillettes?singaporepoliceforce

They may be identified by the thick distinctive cord worn across their right shoulder, called aiguillettes. Did you know that only ADCs from the Singapore Police Force wear silver aiguillettes while the other ADCs wear gold aiguillettes?

caption: DAC Zhang Weihan (left) will assume the Command of Ang Mo Kio Police Division on 3 November 2017. He takes over from AC Lian Ghim Hua (right), who will be moving on to assume the appointment of 2 Deputy Director, CID. AC Lian led Ang Mo Kio Police Division, together with 3rd SCDF Division and CNB Enforcement F as part of the Home Team Northern Sector, to win the Home Team Sector Excellence award for three consecutive years (2015 to 2017).On behalf of Ang Mo Kio Police Division, DAC Zhang thanked AC Lian for his strong leadership, AC Lian and the previous Commanders of Ang Mo Kio Police Division leave big shoes to fill. Together, my officers and I will continue to enhance the strong Police-Community partnership and work together to make our community safer. safeguardingeveryday singaporepoliceforce
cleaned_caption: DAC Zhang Weihan (left) will assume the Command of Ang Mo Kio Police Division on 3 November 2017. He takes over from AC Lian Ghim Hua (right), who will be moving on to assume the appointment of Deputy Director, CID. AC Lian led Ang Mo Kio Police Division, together with 3rd SCDF Division and CNB Enforcement as part of the Home Team Northern Sector, to win the Home Team Sector Excellence award for three consecutive years (2015 to 2017). On behalf of Ang Mo Kio Police Division, DAC Zhang thanked AC Lian for his strong leadership; AC Lian and the previous Commanders of Ang Mo Kio Police Division leave big shoes to fill. Together, my officers and I will continue to enhance the strong Police-Community partnership and work together to make our community safer.

caption: DSP Tan Boon Heng was recognised for his 40 years of service at the SPF Service Medals Presentation Ceremony 2016 held last week. After joining the force as a Police Constable in 1972, DSP Tan rose through the ranks. He is currently the Commanding Officer of Ang Mo Kio South Neighbourhood Police Centre.Reflecting on his career, DSP Tan said, A challenging career with its highs and lows. As I reflect, I feel that it is a fulfilling career which have given me many memorable experiences. Together with DSP Tan, over 1000 officers were recognised for their good conduct and long service at the presentation ceremony.Thank you for your dedication to the force! :) SPFPridetbt
cleaned_caption: DSP Tan was recognised for his 40 years of service at the SPF Service Medals Presentation Ceremony 2016 held last week. After joining the force as a Police Constable in 1972, he rose through the ranks. He is currently the Commanding Officer of Ang Mo Kio South Neighbourhood Police Centre. Reflecting on his career, he said, "A challenging career with its highs and lows. As I reflect, I feel that it is a fulfilling career which have given me many memorable experiences." Together with him, over 1000 officers were recognised for their good conduct and long service at the presentation ceremony. Thank you for your dedication to the force! :)

caption: Crimewatch made its debut on 30 November 1986, showcasing the work of the Singapore Police Force. Many other stories of Singaporeans combating corruption are on display at CPIBs roving exhibition Declassified: Corruption Matters, now on at the National Library till 22 May. Some cases are being made public for the first time in 64 years!We should never take Singapores clean system for granted. Grateful to the men and women whose honesty, integrity and resolve keep our country transparent and incorrupt. LHL (Photo courtesy of Abdul Hakim)

caption: SAFEGUARDING SINGAPORES WATERS This afternoon, Minister for Home Affairs Mr K Shanmugam visited the Police Coast Guard (PCG) to observe PCGs counter-terrorism and maritime security measures. During the visit, Minister K Shanmugam was briefed on PCGs new capabilities which include enhanced surveillance systems. He also observed a live demonstration showcasing polices readiness when responding to hijack and hostage situations at sea. The visit ended off with a sea demonstration of PCGs latest fleet of vessels - the Patrol Interdiction Boats and 2nd Generation PK Interceptors. At the visit, Minister emphasized the importance of PCGs role in safeguarding our waters to ensure the safety and security of Singapore. safeguardingeverydaysingaporepoliceforce
cleaned_caption: SAFEGUARDING SINGAPORE'S WATERS This afternoon, Minister for Home Affairs visited the Police Coast Guard (PCG) to observe PCG's counter-terrorism and maritime security measures. During the visit, the Minister was briefed on PCG's new capabilities which include enhanced surveillance systems. He also observed a live demonstration showcasing the police's readiness when responding to hijack and hostage situations at sea. The visit ended off with a sea demonstration of PCG's latest fleet of vessels - the Patrol Interdiction Boats and 2nd Generation PK Interceptors. At the visit, the Minister emphasized the importance of PCG's role in safeguarding our waters to ensure the safety and security of Singapore. #safeguardingeverydaysingaporepoliceforce

caption: On 27 November 2015, Deputy Team Leaders of the Courts Police Unit, Station Inspectors Quek Suan and Jahabar Sadiq performed Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) on a man who had collapsed in one of the court rooms and became unresponsive. After two rounds of chest compressions and mouth-to-mouth breathing, the man suddenly gasped for air and became responsive. He was subsequently sent to hospital where he made a full recovery.Recounted SI Quek, "As a police officer, it was instinctive for me to act." For their quick actions in administering first aid to the man, both Central Division officers were awarded the Survivor Awards Singapore yesterday. singaporepoliceforceSPFPride
cleaned_caption: On 27 November 2015, Deputy Team Leaders of the Courts Police Unit performed Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) on a man who had collapsed in one of the court rooms and became unresponsive. After two rounds of chest compressions and mouth-to-mouth breathing, the man suddenly gasped for air and became responsive. He was subsequently sent to hospital where he made a full recovery. "As a police officer, it was instinctive for me to act," recounted one of the officers. For their quick actions in administering first aid to the man, both Central Division officers were awarded the Survivor Awards Singapore yesterday.

caption: There is a wave of nostalgia as our Police contingent from the Vintage Parade comes into view, showcasing the vintage Police uniform. caption: Take a walk down memory lane with us at the Police Heritage Centre this Jubilee Weekend!The Police Heritage Centre is opening its gallery from 7-10 August 2015. Visitors will get the chance to learn more about the Singapore Police Forces rich history through a 1.5 hour guided tour. The tours are conducted at the following timeslots daily: 10am, 11.30am, 2.30pm and 4pm. Hurry and book a visit by contacting us at 6478 2123 or spf_police_heritage.gov.sg. SG50 singaporepoliceforce jubileeweekend

caption: Behind the precision and coordination of the NDP Guard of Honour Contingent stands a trainer. Every year, SSSgt Ridzuan Zakaria trains a fresh batch of recruits from zero to perfection. We start from scratch with every batch, teaching them the basic drills and arms drill, how to march and how to handle a SAR21. Once the trainees are familiar with the drills, we will move on to the parade sequence. It is hard work and we start training in April all the way to NDP. This year marks SSSgt Ridzuans 10th year in NDP as the Chief Trainer for the Police GOH!NDP2015 Singapore SG50 singaporepoliceforce
cleaned_caption: Behind the precision and coordination of the NDP Guard of Honour Contingent stands a trainer. Every year, SSSgt trains a fresh batch of recruits from zero to perfection. We start from scratch with every batch, teaching them the basic drills and arms drill, how to march and how to handle a SAR21. Once the trainees are familiar with the drills, we will move on to the parade sequence. It is hard work and we start training in April all the way to NDP. This year marks SSSgt's 10th year in NDP as the Chief Trainer for the Police GOH! #NDP2015 #Singapore #SG50 #singaporepoliceforce

caption: Did you know that we have a pair of non-identical twins in this years NDP Guard-of-Honour (GOH) Contingent? Si Ern said, SG50 is a big milestone for Singapore and we are very honoured to be part of the celebration. We will definitely look back on this as a fond memory and we hope that in SG100, we can participate in the parade together again in our 70s! NDP2015 Singapore SG50 singaporepoliceforce
